wp.subject: ./rexsl-core/src/main/java/com/rexsl/trap/ExceptionTrap.java
wp.description: ./rexsl-core/src/main/java/com/rexsl/trap/ExceptionTrap.java This class should be serializable, but it's not. It doesn't restore its state after deserialization. We should create a test for it and then fix the defect.

wp.description: ./rexsl-test/src/main/java/com/rexsl/test/JaxbConverter.java This 'unchecked' warning should be removed somehow

wp.subject: ./rexsl-page/src/main/java/com/rexsl/page/CookieBuilder.java
wp.description: ./rexsl-page/src/main/java/com/rexsl/page/CookieBuilder.java Somehow we should specify PORT in the cookie. Without this param the site doesn't work in localhost:9099 in Chrome. Works fine in Safari, but not in Chrome. see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1612177

wp.subject: ./rexsl-core/src/test/java/com/rexsl/core/ContextResourceResolverTest.java
wp.description: ./rexsl-core/src/test/java/com/rexsl/core/ContextResourceResolverTest.java The majority of tests here are disabled, because YMOCK doesn't work at the moment with this Socket mocking mechanism. As soon as this feature is fixed in YMOCK let's use it here

wp.subject: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/src/test/java/com/rexsl/maven/checks/RexslFilesCheckTest.java
wp.description: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/src/test/java/com/rexsl/maven/checks/RexslFilesCheckTest.java This test is IGNORED because I don't think that we should prohibit users to create custom directories here. Let's just focus on file types.

wp.subject: ./rexsl-page/src/main/java/com/rexsl/page/JaxbBundle.java
wp.description:
./rexsl-page/src/main/java/com/rexsl/page/JaxbBundle.java A new design would be required for this class.
The problems:
  • this.content and this.parent are used as flags, not only as data storage variables.
  • there are three different 'types' combined in one class: root element (parent == null), node element (content == null), and leaf element.

The solution: A new hierarchy of classes:
interface TreeNode

abstract AbstractNode implements TreeNode
+name: String
+attributes: ConcurrentMap

abstract SubNode extends AbstractNode
+parent: TreeNode

InnerNode extends SubNode
+children: List

LeafNode extends SubNode
+content: String

DeadNode implements TreeNode
// this is the node we set as parent in root node

wp.subject: ./rexsl-test/src/mock/java/com/rexsl/test/ContainerMocker.java
wp.description: ./rexsl-test/src/mock/java/com/rexsl/test/ContainerMocker.java It is impossible to match parameter and body at the same time. ./rexsl-test/src/mock/java/com/rexsl/test/ContainerMocker.java It is impossible to match parameter and body at the same time.

wp.description: ./rexsl-core/src/test/java/com/rexsl/core/RestfulServletTest.java This test is disabled because of a defect in Jersey: http://java.net/jira/browse/JERSEY-1128. Once it is resolved we can try to enable the test and see how it works.

wp.subject: ./rexsl-test/src/test/java/com/rexsl/test/RestTesterTest.java
wp.description: ./rexsl-test/src/test/java/com/rexsl/test/RestTesterTest.java Is it possible to initialize input variable with InputStream from request without side effects on request? request's parameters retrieve is done lazily and requires InputStream rewinded to it's start ./rexsl-test/src/test/java/com/rexsl/test/RestTesterTest.java Is it possible to initialize input variable with InputStream from request without side effects on request? request's parameters retrieve is done lazily and requires InputStream rewinded to it's start

wp.description: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/src/main/java/com/rexsl/maven/PackageMojo.java Only properties from PROPERTIES section in pom.xml are supported. I don't know how to get access to all other project props.

wp.subject: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/src/test/java/com/rexsl/maven/PackageMojoTest.java
wp.description: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/src/test/java/com/rexsl/maven/PackageMojoTest.java Would be better to implement filtering in method under test with custom Reader. Current implementation loads the entire file into memory, which may be a problem if the file is too big.

wp.subject: ./pom.xml
wp.description: ./pom.xml This is a temporary measure, until Qulice implements this validation. Once it's implemented in qulice - just remove this plugin from here.

wp.subject: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/pom.xml
wp.description: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/pom.xml This test is disabled (although it works fine) because I don't know how to stop its execution. It starts Jetty and stays waiting. There should be some way of canceling it somehow... http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINVOKER-132

wp.subject: ./rexsl-core/src/main/java/com/rexsl/trap/StaticTemplate.java
wp.description: ./rexsl-core/src/main/java/com/rexsl/trap/StaticTemplate.java We support only local resources now. This implementation has to be extended in order to support different formats of URI, incl. 'file:...', 'http:...', etc.

wp.description: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/src/test/java/com/rexsl/maven/checks/CssStaticCheckTest.java The validation doesn't work. CSSLint, for some reason, returns incorrect report when being executed from Maven. When the same file is executed from command line it works correctly. I don't know why it's happening.

wp.description: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/src/test/java/com/rexsl/maven/RunMojoTest.java This test is not implemented yet, but has to be implemented somehow. We should create a new thread and wait there for RunMojo execution termination.

wp.subject: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/src/it/structure-failure/pom.xml
wp.description: ./rexsl-maven-plugin/target/it/all-correct/pom.xml If you change this path to something different from '/' there will be many problems with paths of XSL and CSS files. It's definitely a defect and should be fixed. ./rexsl-maven-plugin/target/it/structure-failure/target/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/META-INF/maven/com.rexsl.plugin/structure-failure/pom.xml If you change this path to something different from '/' there will be many problems with paths of XSL and CSS files.
